fields.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
The ID of the survey question. The ID is either a Workday ID or reference ID. Example reference ID: Survey_Question_ID=12345
The order to display the survey question.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
If true, a survey recipient is required to answer this question.

The maximum number of selections for a multi-select question. This field is required for multi-select questions. This integer must be greater than 1 and equal to or less than the number of the multiple choice answers.
Contains the question multiple choice answer data. You can't edit a multiple choice answer that's in use by another survey.

Maximum_Number_of_Answer_Selections.description: The maximum number of selections for a multi-select question. This field is required for multi-select questions. This integer must be greater than 1 and equal to or less than the number of the multiple choice answers.

Question_Display_Option_Reference_Questi.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Question_Display_Option_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Question_Multiple_Choice_Answer_Data.description: Contains the question multiple choice answer data. You can't edit a multiple choice answer that's in use by another survey.

Question_Order.description: The order to display the survey question.

Question_Required.description: If true, a survey recipient is required to answer this question.

Question_Type_Reference_Question_Type_ID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Question_Type_Reference_WID.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Survey_Question_ID.description: The ID of the survey question. The ID is either a Workday ID or reference ID. Example reference ID: Survey_Question_ID=12345

TalentSurvey_Talent_Survey_Reference_WID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
